segments.text: I notice the woman drying her plate, focused and calm in her little world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her dress and apron seem so domestic and reassuring amidst the chaos brewing behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But then, I glance back at the sink, and I feel a wave of disbelief wash over me.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she not see the water flooding over the edge, soaking her feet?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Every moment that passes, I feel my heart race with worry for the children.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy looks so determined, reaching into that cookie jar like itâ€™s a treasure chest.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the girl, standing with her hand raised, she must be dreaming of cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But I can't shake the feeling that this joyous moment is about to end in a disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's odd; the kitchen feels so alive yet so perilous at the same time.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could just call out to them, to alert them to the chaos around them.
segments.speaker: PAR
